result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Defendant Daniel L Schultz in court.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel in court for Daniel L Schultz.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
THIS COVERS 21CF354, 22CF48, 22CF107, 22TR831, 22TR920, and 21TR1730.

22TR831 - Guilty plea entered. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.
22TR920 - Dismissed.
21TR1730 - Dismissed.

22CF107 - Dismissed and read-in.

22CF48 - Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.

21CF354 -
Count 1 - Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.
Count 3 - State moves to amend to OWI 2nd. Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.
Counts 2, 7, & 8 - Dismissed and read-in.

Court orders PSI in 21CF354 & 22CF48.  Must report to DOC today.  Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.

(Clerked by ABarnes)
Court relates and orders: 
22TR831 -
$811.50 forfeiture with 60 days to pay.
6 month drivers license revocation.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. .087 non aggravated.

21CF354 - Count 3:
$1,555.00 fine with 60 days to pay.
20 days jail. Must report to jail by 5:30 p.m. on Friday, November 4, 2022. Credit for time served. Huber and good time granted.
16 month license revocation
16 month ignition interlock device
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. .206 non aggravated.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

Sentence credit to be submitted by stipulation of counsel. Defendant will qualify for 1/2 priced IID.

Felony admonitions given.
State's Motion In Limine for Video
Jury trial - 12 person on November 9, 2022 at 08:00 am.

10:07 AM Defendant Daniel L Schultz in court.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel appeared by video for Daniel L Schultz. Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
COVERS 21CF354, 22CF48, 22CF107 (ARGN), 21TR1730, 22TR831 & 22TR920.

22CF107 - Formal reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.  No agreement.  JT set for at 11/09/22 8:00 a.m. Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than November 1, 2022.  Reminder note given in court.  Address and phone number confirmed.  

22TR831 and 22TR920  - Not guilty pleas entered.   Continue to track with 21CF107.

21CF354, 22CF48 & 21TR1730  are to be sent to Judge Boyle for further scheduling.

2:46 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel L Schultz appeared by video.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel appeared by video for Daniel L Schultz. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial. Must appear in person. JA to send NOH.
Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

21CF48 - Reading waived, not guilty pleas entered. Hearing set for 7/6/2022 at 10:00 before Judge Boyle.  Parties may appear by Zoom. 

21CF354 - Reading waived, not guilty pleas entered. Hearing set for 7/6/2022 at 10:00 before Judge Boyle.  Parties may appear by Zoom.

11:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel L Schultz not in court. Attorney Michael Steuer advises he qualifies for Public Defender.
Court finds good cause for adjournment.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel L Schultz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Daniel L Schultz for today.
Defendant needs to contact Public Defender's office. State requests cash bond. 1:04 Attorney Rockow and Defendant put in a break out room 1:06 Attorney Rockow requests lower cash bond. Bond set. Next date may be by zoom.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
